title: New and adding to contact lists
content:
I have a contact list with 31 names in it. I went to add one more name to the contact list today (TBird V102.10.0 - 64 bit) and could see the added name in the contact list. When going to the new email "Write" dialog box and entering that list name...the added entry was not in the list of name populated.

So, I decided to create a new list and adding the new contact in the new list. Before doing this, I went into the Properties of the contact list and renamed it adding "OLD" to the name. Then I created a brand new list wih 2023 at the end of the name. I can see all the names in the new contact list. However, when trying to "Write" a new email using the contact lists, neither the renamed "OLD" list or the new "2023" list was offered as an option in the "Write" dialog box.

The original list name was DI_FBIRA (I renamed this to OLD_DI_FBIRA). The new list name is DI_FBIRA_2023

When trying to write an email and wanting to select the DI_FBIRA_2023 list.....the only name showing in the offers was DI_FBIRA (which no longer existed - see uploaded file for a screenshot of the "new" list set).

Every time I tried to take a screenshot of the new email using the "new" contact list with either the Windows snipping tool or PicPick, the popup window showing the offered matches showed up disappeared). I tried restarting TBird and even rebooted the PC but that same problem remained when trying to use the "new" contact list.

A known issue with TBird V102.10???

Kevin
creator: kevmeist

title: Mails with different subject are grouped wrongly under same threaded
content: I have some mailed are grouped wrongly under a threaded. Is there any setting can configure how mail are grouped into a threaded?
creator: monkeyj

title: Reading Thunderbird archive files
content:
So I have set up Thunderbird to include a Local Folder on my hard drive on which I copy email folders I want to archive safely. I can of course find and read any archived email by opening the Local Folder from within Thunderbird. But is there any way of retrieving and reading archived emails without doing so through Thunderbird? For instance, I want to copy the entire email archive onto a removable hard disk, so as to be able to consult it from other computers.

I can find Local Folders on my hard disk, and within that a folder called "Archive.sbd". That in turn gives access to documents called, for instance, "emails.2021" and "emails.2021.msf". The problem is that opening document "emails.2021" leads to an unusable mass of binary code. So my question is, can the archived emails only be read from within Thunderbird?
creator: stathatos1

title: How to change expiration date of gpg keys
content:
Hi,

I need help changing the expiration date of my gpg keys (TB 102.10).

I already extended the date on the command line (gpg --edit-keys), but Thunderbird does not recognize this change.

Maybe it has its own keystore - don't know. I try to change the key from Thunderbird's key manager. Unfortunately it tells, the key has "a complex structure" and cannot be changed. Yes, the key has subkeys. But what can I do now?

Thanks

title: New GMAIL accounts can't be added to Thunderbird
content:
Hello

I have been trying this for a while now, I originally thought it was just myself not being able to understand the settings behind the new OAUTH2 configuration. But I think the problem is much more severe than I thought.

So with all new gmail account post May-2022 I understand if they never had an app password, they won't work with thunderbird, mind you mine is at v102 as of late.

So, I tried adding a new account, went through the OAUTH2 steps, window popping up with gmail asking for username and password, goes on to asking me to allow third party app to share information, I click on Allow, but the thunderbird settings go on to show a failure.

So, I went on to manually configure settings, followed many links, some from google and some from thunderbird support forums, and none of them worked. I see that most of them aren't recent either, so probably they are prior to the current shift in google's policies.

Again, went to advanced config, confirmed the settings for IMAP and SMTP, yet no progress.

I know not much to share here, but here is everything: Windows 10 pro (22H2) with thunderbird 102.10.0 (64-bit) Incoming IMAP:

Incoming IMAP: imap.gmail.com (993) SSL/TLS OAuth2 Outgoing SMTP: smtp.gmail.com (465) SSL/TLS OAuth2

I'll attach the screen-captures to better explain what's going on. The steps followed, are really not that complicated, going through the automated way, then manual, then advanced config. Screen-captures follow the same flow.

So for the following concern: What's the future for Thunderbird with gmail accounts? How can I fix this? Outlook works straight without any issues when adding a new existing gmail account. Microsoft® Outlook® 2016 MSO (Version 2208 Build 16.0.15601.20590) 64-bit

Best Regards xDR1TeK
creator: xdrone

title: Thunderbird
content:
Tentei usar a orientação "Como mover um perfil - Ocasionalmente, você pode querer mover um perfil ou dizer ao Thunderbird para usar um perfil armazenado em outro local". Porém encontro, no arq. profiles.ini, essas duas entradas abaixo com Path. Qual a entrada correta a ser alterada e, por favor, a sintaxe para o novo local (d:\Documentos\Mozilla-1de4eec8-1241-4177-a864-e594e8d1fb38).

[Profile1] Name=default IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/fbkriuij.default Default=1

[Profile0] Name=default-release IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/4c48c2t5.default-release

Grato

title: Thunderbird performance very slow
content:
Just reposting rudytheelder's 2021 post as it was not selected as the solution to another User's performance issue. It solved a long-standing problem for me - slow to load, download, change folders - basically all Thunderbird actions took 5-30 seconds to execute. Shout out to rudytheelder!!!


"My Thunderbird was very slow --- this problem has come and gone many times. Lately is was very slow in moving files between directories. Today I did these two things and it works great so far: (1) Go to Tools | Clear Recent History and select Everything. (2) Increase the cache size. Go to Tools | Options | General | Disk Space and Check "Overide automatic cashe mangement" and change the number in "Use up to --- MB of space for the cache" to 1024.

Modified July 8, 2021 at 1:32:48 PM PDT by rudytheelder"
creator: rrbeck1

title: Problem with filter rules that mark incoming Gmail as read
content:
I have Thunderbird mail filter rules that automatically mark messages as read. They work fine on Inbox, but the "copies" in Gmail's All Messages and Important folders in Thunderbird don't get marked as read, so it looks like there are unread messages when there aren't any.

When I manually open those Gmail folders in Thunderbird, they get updated correctly. The problem is that it doesn't happen automatically.

When I manually mark a message as read in my Inbox in Thunderbird, it works fine and the other Gmail folders in Thunderbird get updated correctly although it's not quite instant.

Is there a fix, etc. for this?

Thunderbird 102.10.0 (64-bit) on kubuntu 18.04 Linux

title: How to stop Thunderbird from attempting to download certificates from the directory
content:
New behavior - maybe with 102.10.0 or other recent version - when I compose a message I often get the attached pop up message:

Downloading Certificates Searching the directory for recipients' certificates. This may take a few minutes.

I've been waiting for 10 or more and it's still there.

The error console shows mailnews.ldap errors - "NetworkError" -> "TCPSocketErrorEvent"

I have an LDAP addressbook pointing to our AD server using port 636/SSL and simple authentication.

Sometimes it seems like the Downloading window just flashes briefly and things are fine - still the same errors on the error console though.

I don't see anywhere it the settings the ability to change whether or not TB searches in the directory for certificates.

thunderbird-102.10.0-2.el8_7.alma.x86_64

title: Auto-reply (signed, with attachment) goes out garbled
content:
Cryptographically-signed email is underrated, huh?

I'm having trouble with an auto-reply message. The template is stored S/MIME signed with my certificate attached. When it goes out with my rule, it comes across like this:

First line follows this bar------------------------------

This is a cryptographically signed message in MIME format. --------------ms080007030703030909010407 Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="------------VCsB4Q8J6rh03qH9rm1v6c30" --------------VCsB4Q8J6rh03qH9rm1v6c30 Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8 Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit Thank you for emailing Isaac Koch --Â your messageÂ is received.

Without being digitally, cryptographically signed, it is reviewed under "routine" priority.Â For "Inbox" priority, send your email with a "digital signature" included, please.

S/MIME is the defacto standard encryption.Â The major phones and apps already support it!

Every message you send unencrypted is public.Â With a letter, you can see if it's been opened.Â Now you know this email is open.

But the prudent orator always knows his audience.

The first step is having your own certificate, yes, your very own!!!Â Do you need help creating your S/MIME certificate?

If you need help, on Mac you can create a certificate with Keychain > Certificate Assistant > Create Certificate.Â On Windows, it's also possible: search "create self certificate windows s/mime".

Next email, you can use your certificate to sign your message and avoid this notice.

Thanks for reading to the end.Â Here is my certificate and certificate authority for your system's trusting.Â Working together, we'll stop junk email, won't we?

This is an automatically generated message.Â You now have my certificates for trusting in your system.
